questiontext.text:
What will be printed by the following Java code?


int a = 5, b = 10;
if (a > b)
    if (a > 0)
        System.out.println("A");
    else
        System.out.println("B");
else
    System.out.println("C");

generalfeedback.text: The condition a > b is false (5 > 10), so the outer else executes: System.out.println("C");

questiontext.text:
What is the output of the following code?


int x = 4;
int y = 10;
String result = (x * 2 > y) ? "High" : (x + 2 == y) ? "Equal" : "Low";
System.out.println(result);

generalfeedback.text:
x * 2 is 8, which is not greater than y = 10, so check next: x + 2 == y → 6 == 10 → false. Therefore, result = "Low". Wait, this is incorrect — let's reanalyze:

  • x * 2 = 8 → false for first condition
  • x + 2 == y → 6 == 10 → false
  • So result = "Low"

Correct answer should be Low. (So we need to fix the answer!)
